result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demarius Dijon Hughes

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matt W Kline in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Calendar Call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court lifted the stay of the Bench Warrant.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Attorney Matt W Kline in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference. 
DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance and  request a calendar call date.  
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the Commissioner, no action on bail, and STAYED issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Calendar call scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
$500 signature bond previously set to remain.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Demarius Dijon Hughes in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Mark Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($500.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matt W Kline in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Pretial. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. 
Court ordered Bench Warrant Issued. Remand to Commissioner and forfeiture of bond.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Demarius Dijon Hughes in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Demarius Dijon Hughes in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demarius Dijon Hughes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST:   https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
